page.title: 15The Port of Shoreham
page.content: The Port is situated at the mouth of the River Adur.It is the nearest South coast port to London and the largest commercial port between Dover and Southampton.It is therefore in a unique position for serving a large part of South-East England with it's rising population and industrial growth.The port has an excellent record for efficiency and good labour relations. For centuries ship and boat building was a major industry at he port and the latter still continues. Today,in 1985,the port extends over a distance of nearly 5 miles and divides into three sections,the Western Arm formed by the lower reaches of the River Adur on the Western side of the Entrance,the Eastern Arm between the Entrance and the Locks,and the Canal,which is an
